avalancheActivity.comment: As a consequence of new snow and northwesterly wind, further wind slabs formed in the last few days in places that are protected from the wind. The new snow and wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant. Wind slabs are to be found in particular in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain. They are covered with new snow and are difficult to recognise. In particular on very steep shady slopes the avalanches can be released in the various wind slab layers and reach large size.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The wind slabs must be evaluated with care and prudence at intermediate and high altitudes.

snowpackStructure.comment: 10 to 40 cm of snow has fallen since Friday above approximately 2000 m. The wind was strong. The wind has transported the new snow significantly. The more recent wind slabs are poorly bonded with the old snowpack. The new snow and wind slabs are lying on a crust in particular on sunny slopes below approximately 2400 m. Snow depths vary greatly at intermediate and high altitudes, depending on the infuence of the wind.

avalancheActivity.comment: The storm force wind has transported the fresh and old snow significantly. The fresh and older wind slabs represent the main danger. Avalanches can in isolated cases be released by small loads and reach medium size. This applies in particular at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack, as well as in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain. Between approximately 2400 and 3000 m the avalanche prone locations are more prevalent.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs are to be evaluated with care and prudence.

snowpackStructure.comment: In particular at elevated altitudes snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind. Sunshine and high temperatures gave rise to consolidation of the snowpack at low and intermediate altitudes. At low and intermediate altitudes only a little snow is lying.

avalancheActivity.comment:
In all aspects hardly any snow is lying.
Even in moderately steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the icy crust.
avalancheActivity.highlights: From a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying.

avalancheActivity.comment:
In these regions from a snow sport perspective, insufficient snow is lying.
Even in moderately steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the icy crust.
avalancheActivity.highlights: In all aspects hardly any snow is lying.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The wind slabs can be released, especially by large additional loads, at elevated altitudes. The avalanche prone locations are rather rare. These avalanche prone locations are to be found at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack above approximately 2400 m.
In some places wind slabs are lying on an icy crust. Restraint should be exercised because avalanches can sweep people along and give rise to falls.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs require caution, especially along the border with France.

snowpackStructure.comment: Below approximately 2400 m from a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying. At higher altitudes snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind.
